ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: reclining on them face to face.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: reclining on them, arrayed face to face;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Reclining on them, facing each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Reclining on them, facing one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: reclining upon them, set face to face,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: reclining on them facing each other;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: reclining on them, face to face.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Reclining on them, facing each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: they shall recline, facing each other,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Reclining on them, facing one another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Reclining on them, facing each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:16] reclining on them, face to face (muttaki’īna ‘alayhā mutaqābilīna constitute two circumstantial qualifiers referring to the [subject] person of the predicate [‘they’]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 640 (Reclining) in comfort (therein) on couches (face to face) upon visitation.
